title: About Gorzelinski
description: Hi, I‚Äôm Matthew. I‚Äôm an engineer with erudite aspirations.
heading: And here‚Äôs my short story
metaAlt: Centered text Portfolio on white background
story: My earliest memories are bound to electronics. As a kid, I was thrilled every time I turned on PlayStation. Every startup sounded like going through a portal, entering another digital galaxy. That galaxy absorbed me back then. After 20 years, I‚Äôm still there.

Over the years, I‚Äôve become more and more interested in electronics. When I was a teenager, I got my first phone - a Sony Ericsson k300i. I still remember its specs: 12MB of memory, VGA camera, and 65k color display. These numbers weren‚Äôt telling me much back then. But I still liked to analyze them (from mobile phone companies‚Äô flyers) and compare them between different phone models. I‚Äôm still doing that, to be honest. Nowadays, I follow technological blogs and vlogs.

My passion for numbers didn‚Äôt end there. Math was my favorite subject in school (I was a strange child, I know). After graduating high school (math and physics extended), I started studying at Poznan University of Technology.

I‚Äôve chosen Electronics and Telecommunications course after many hours of research and careful consideration. Yeah, but...not really. I‚Äôve based my choice on associations and chance. Fortunately, I was lucky. In university, I could chalk out math equations. I was also solving boolean equations and making electronic circuits based on them. I‚Äôve programmed some (micro)processors. I‚Äôve also had the opportunity to configure routers and learn more about computer networks. I was learning about networks not only in university.

During my studies, I worked at Semcore as SEO Specialist. I started creating websites then. The first of them looked awful, but I liked it. After several months of self-studying, I started working as a Front-end developer at Af Agency. I‚Äôve had an opportunity to collaborate with brands like Volkswagen or Skoda. I‚Äôve also experienced the nightmare of creating a newsletter for email clients. Good times. Not ironically.

I graduated in 2020 with an engineer title. Now I legitimately can use phrases like ‚ÄúTrust me, I‚Äôm an engineer.‚Äù My thesis was about tools and technologies used to create apps and websites. But it didn‚Äôt end there. I learn about web dev every day. I watch lectures, listen to podcasts, and read books.

‚ÄúUncle Bob‚Äôs‚Äù books occupy some space on my bookshelf. However, I‚Äôm not limiting myself only to computer science books. My Kallax bends from psychology, philosophy, biography, and especially science books. I also like other media. Games, movies, music - you name it.
If I do not study and consume media (or coffee), I probably work out, walk, watch memes or think hard about cognitive biases.

facts.description: Vacuum cleaner or hairdryer sounds have never annoyed me. I like them. It appears odd, but something is soothing in this kind of white noise to many people. ‚ÄúVacum Cleaner Sound‚Äù videos on Youtube have millions of views. You can even buy devices that generate white noise.

facts.description: Myers‚ÄìBriggs Type Indicator is a personality test to identify a person‚Äôs type, strengths, and preferences. I wouldn‚Äôt take it too seriously, but it‚Äôs a fun exercise. The description of my type states that I‚Äôm a cold, lonely villain (I might have exaggerated that a bit).

facts.heading: ‚òÄÔ∏è I sneeze in the bright light
facts.description: It‚Äôs not as uncontrollable as if I‚Äôm allergic. On a sunny day, I feel the urge to sneeze after I‚Äôve just gone outside. I‚Äôve done some reading, and it even has a name - photic sneeze reflex. It‚Äôs a rare condition (affecting 10 - 30% population) caused by gens. Thanks, dad!

facts.heading: ‚è±Ô∏è I could pass some of the Navy SEALs Physical Screening Tests
facts.description: One part of the test requires doing a minimum of 42 push-ups in 2 minutes. The last part is a 1.5-mile (~2.41 km) run in under 11 minutes. I‚Äôve done that a few times at the gym. I hope I can still do that.

facts.description: Due to some typo in my grandfather‚Äôs documents, my surname is ‚ÄúGorzeli≈Ñski‚Äù (with polish letters). The correct spelling should be probably ‚ÄúGarzeli≈Ñski.‚Äù Anyway, it‚Äôs hard to pronounce either way - even for polish people.

facts.heading: üìò I‚Äôm a bookworm
facts.description: Last year I read 48 books. I don‚Äôt know any fast reading techniques. Actually, I‚Äôm a slow reader who pauses and ponders. I just read over an hour on average every day.

core.heading: My core values
core.description: The values I try to live by.

values.heading: Truth
values.description: Probably one of the most important. It is at the root of most of my endeavors. I constantly expand and verify my views. I want the worldview in my head to be as close as possible to reality.

values.heading: Curiosity
values.description: ‚ÄúI have no special talents. I am only passionately curious.‚Äù - Einstein once wrote to his friend (this quote is real - I verified it). He was humble. I‚Äôll never be as talented as Einstein was, but his curiosity can be an inspiration for me. Discovering and understanding new knowledge can be a reward for its own sake.

values.heading: Empathy
values.description: In my truth-seeking journey, I‚Äôm not alone. I stand on the shoulders of giants. Most of the things in my life I owe to other people. I should be grateful, give some of that help back, and try my best to understand their point of view.
